name: Budapest to Bucharest
slogan: Explore Eastern Europe's historic Hungary and Romania
summary:
From the beautiful Baroque churches of Budapest to the haunted castles of Transylvania, 
                    this ten-day journey across Eastern Europe provides a fascinating insight into an intriguing region. 
                    Learn about the failed Turkish invasion of Eger and take a wine cellar tour in the Valley of the Beautiful Women. 
                    Become acquainted with traditional Romanian culture and customs in Maramures. Tour the medieval churches of Brasov, 
                    including Bran Castle and dine with a local family on an overnight homestay in Viscri. 
                    Visit Bucharest's 12-storey Palace of Parliament and enjoy free time to explore your favourite sites further. 
                    This jam-packed journey perfectly introduces two Eastern European treasures, 
                    soaked in fascinating history and featuring modern-day delights.

inclusions.transport: Train, Public bus, Private vehicle, Metro, Taxi
inclusions.accommodation: Hotel (6 nights), Pension (2 night), Homestay with shared facilities (1 night)
activities: Maramures - Day Tour with Local Guide
Bucharest - Walking Tour with Local Guide

name: Eastern Europe Explorer
slogan: Tour from bustling Budapest to Istanbul through enchanting Hungary, Romania, Bulgaria.
summary:
Be mesmerised on this explorer tour through the best and most beautiful regions from Eastern Europe to Turkey. 
                    Explore the captivating cities of Budapest, Bucharest and Sofia and Istanbul. 
                    Sample culinary delights with local folk in Viscri, be inspired by the traditional craft workshops in Plovdiv, 
                    hear enthralling myths from Transylvania and visit the quaint town of Bansko, snug at the foot of the Pirin Mountains 
                    and bask in the transcontinental glory of Istanbul. This is a journey full of culture and history, of monuments, 
                    markets and museums, tantalising towns and charming cities.

inclusions.transport: Train, Public bus, Private vehicle, Metro, Tram, Taxi, Chairlift
inclusions.accommodation: Hotel (14 nights), Pension (2 night), Homestay with shared facilities (1 night)
activities: Maramures - Day Tour with Local Guide
Bucharest - Walking Tour with Local Guide
Plovdiv-Private Transfer from Plovdiv Train Station to Plovdiv Hotel
Plovdiv - Walking Tour with Local Guide
Istanbul- Private Transfer from Istanbul Bus Station to Istanbul Hotel
Plovdiv- Private Transfer from Plovdiv Hotel to Plovdiv Bus Station

name: Eastern Europe Express
slogan: Explore from Eastern Europe's Romania and Bulgaria to Turkey
summary:
Embark on a spectacular journey from Romania and through Bulgaria to Istanbul, 
                    discovering the architectural grandeur and quaint cultural enclaves that make this such an intriguing part of the world. 
                    Absorb Bucharest’s austere atmosphere on a guided walking tour, compare age-old places of worship in Sofia, 
                    breathe in crisp alpine air on a hike in the Pirin Mountains, and meander back in time in the Old Town of Plovdiv. 
                    and bask in the glory of transcontinental Istanbul. Relatively short in terms of distance travelled, 
                    this nine-day trip is a fascinating study in just how much regions can change as you cross national borders.

inclusions.transport: Train, Public Bus, Private vehicle, Metro, Taxi
activities: Plovdiv-Private Transfer from Plovdiv Train Station to Plovdiv Hotel
Plovdiv - Walking Tour with Local Guide
Istanbul- Private Transfer from Istanbul Bus Station to Istanbul Hotel
Plovdiv- Private Transfer from Plovdiv Hotel to Plovdiv Bus Station

name: Premium Belgrade to Bucharest
slogan: Grand castles, medieval towns and revolutionary history in Romania.
summary:
From the beautiful Baroque churches of Budapest to the haunted castles of Transylvania, 
                    this ten-day journey across Eastern Europe provides a fascinating insight into an intriguing region. 
                    Learn about the failed Turkish invasion of Eger and take a wine cellar tour in the Valley of the Beautiful Women. 
                    Become acquainted with traditional Romanian culture and customs in Maramures. Tour the medieval churches of Brasov, 
                    including Bran Castle and dine with a local family on an overnight homestay in Viscri. 
                    Visit Bucharest's 12-storey Palace of Parliament and enjoy free time to explore your favourite sites further. 
                    This jam-packed journey perfectly introduces two Eastern European treasures,

inclusions.accommodation: Comfortable hotel (9 nights), Feature Stay (1 night)
activities: Azuga - Winery Tour and Tasting with Lunch

name: Halloween in Transylvania (Southbound)
slogan: Spend your spookiest Halloween ever in haunting Romania
summary:
Even without its bloodcurdling myths of Dracula, werewolves, haunted castles and curses, 
                    Romania is an atmospheric destination. And no more so on the spooky holiday of Halloween.
                    Let us introduce you to the beauty of ancient Bucharest, the haunting beauty and mythology of Sighisoara, 
                    and spooky Bran Castle (aka Dracula’s castle) in Brasov. For a spine-tingling adventure this Halloween, 
                    don’t look past this adventure in Transylvania. Mwahahaha.

activities: Cluj Napoca - Halloween Party in Cluj
Cluj Napoca - Walking Tour with Local Guide
Brasov - Walking Tour with Local Guide
Bucharest - Walking Tour with Local Guide

name: Premium Balkans in Depth
destination: Serbia, Romania, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
slogan: From remote islands to ancient salt mines, explore the Balkans in depth
summary:
Unlock the cultural treasure chest of the Balkans on an in-depth 26-day Premium adventure from Split to Bucharest. 
                    Amazing beaches and sunshine give way to medieval towns and castles as lesser known National 
                    Parks provide an incredible mountianous backdrop. Get away from the modern world and in with the locals on 
                    the remote and beautiful island of Lastovo, and soak up ancient riches of Transylvania, and discover 
                    Tara National Park’s spectacular scenery on foot and riding the rails on a historic steam train. 
                    Bursting with culinary delights and cultural wonders - the Balkans has it all.

inclusions.accommodation: Comfortable Hotel (21 nights), Feature Stay (4 nights)
activities: Split - Welcome Dinner at Local Restaurant
Split - Walking Tour with Local Guide
Korcula Island - Korcula Old Town Orientation Walk
Korcula - Local Winery lunch and wine tasting
Trsteno - Olive Farm tasting and brunch
Mostar - Guided Tour with Coffee Experience
Konjic - Armijska Ratna Komanda ARK D-0 (Tito’s Bunker) tour
Sarajevo - Cooking Demo and Home-made Dinner
Azuga - Winery Tour and Tasting with Lunch
